name: Chartjs.Chart

unions.name: Type
unions.comment:
Basic type for a Chart

For charts containing multiple datasets, both a chart type needs to specified
and a type for each dataset. Default Chart.js parameters will inherit from this type.

aliases.name: Chart
aliases.comment:
Main type helper for a Chartjs chart

Both a Data and an Options object must be specified to help configure this chart.
aliases.type: { chartType : Chartjs.Chart.Type, data : Chartjs.Data.Data, options : Chartjs.Options.Options }

values.name: chart
values.comment:
Given attributes and a chart, creates an HTML node using the web component

ChartJs is smart enough to figure out scaling naturally
To set the size of the chart, use CSS styles (either in a stylesheet or using the attributes)

values.name: defaultChart
values.comment: Given a chart type, creates a default chart that can then be updated.

values.name: setData
values.comment: Update the data for a chart.

values.name: setOptions
values.comment: Update the options for a chart.

name: Chartjs.Common
comment:
Common types used for various configuration properties

@docs PointStyle, LineCap, LineJoin, Position, Align, PointProperty, IndexAxis

unions.name: Align
unions.comment: Alignment for certain text properties, such as title

unions.name: IndexAxis
unions.comment:
Some charts can be transformed from horizontal to vertical by setting the index axis
XAxis will produce a vertical chart (this is the default)
YAxis will produce a horizontal chart

unions.name: PointProperty
unions.comment:
Many properties that apply to datasets
can either be applied to the whole dataset, or to each individual point

For applying a property to every point in the dataset, use the All type
For using a list of properties on a per-point basis, use the PerPoint type

unions.name: Position
unions.comment: Positioning often used in options such as axes and legends

name: Chartjs.Data

unions.name: DataSet
unions.comment:
Type wrapper for an individual dataset

While this type should match the overall chart type,
it is possible to put multiple types of dataset on one chart

aliases.name: Data
aliases.comment:
All datasets for a chart are contained in a single Data object
This also specifies the category labels, which are shared across datasets
(eg. multiple bar charts with the same categories)
aliases.type: { labels : Maybe.Maybe (List.List String.String), datasets : List.List Chartjs.Data.DataSet }

values.name: addDataset
values.comment:
Add a dataset to a Data object
This is very useful for use with the |> operator

    defaultData
        |> addDataset dataset1
        |> addDataset dataset2

values.name: buildData
values.comment: Build a Data object from a list of labels and a list of datasets

values.name: dataFromLabels
values.comment: Data object with specified labels but no datasets

values.name: defaultData
values.comment: Data object with no labels or datasets defined

values.name: setDatasets
values.comment: Set all the datasets for a Data object

values.name: setLabels
values.comment: Set the labels for a Data object

name: Chartjs.DataSets.Bar

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment:
For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/bar.html>

You should not use the dataset type directly
Instead use the updater pipeline functions:

    defaultBarFromLabel "Example"
        |> setBackgroundColor (Common.All Color.red)
        |> setBorderColor (Common.All Color.white)
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : List.List Basics.Float, hidden : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, order : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, stack : Maybe.Maybe String.String, indexAxis : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.IndexAxis, xAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, yAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), barPercentage : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, barThickness : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Int), borderSkipped : Maybe.Maybe String.String, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), categoryPercentage : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, hoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), maxBarThickness : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, minBarLength : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

values.name: defaultBarFromData
values.comment: Create a Bar dataset with a label and data

values.name: defaultBarFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Bar dataset with just a label

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the bar

values.name: setBarPercentage
values.comment: 0-1 percentage of the available width each bar should be within the category width.

values.name: setBarThickness
values.comment: Manually force the width (in pixels) of each bar

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the bar

values.name: setBorderRadius
values.comment: Border radius for each bar

values.name: setBorderSkipped
values.comment:
Which edge to skip drawing border for
One of: 'bottom' 'left' 'top' 'right'

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Stroke width of the bar in pixels

values.name: setCategoryPercentage
values.comment: Percent (0-1) of the available width each category should be within the sample width.

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as a bar

values.name: setHidden
values.comment: Set whether this dataset should be hidden from the chart

values.name: setHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the bar when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the bar when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Border width of the bar when hovered

values.name: setIndexAxis
values.comment:
Which axis to use for indexing
Set to XAxis for a vertical chart, set to YAxis for a horizontal chart

values.name: setLabel
values.comment: Set the label for this dataset

values.name: setMaxBarThickness
values.comment:
Max bar thickness, in pixels
If set, bars will not be thicker than this value

values.name: setMinBarLength
values.comment:
Minimum bar length, in pixels
If set, bars will not be shorter than this value

values.name: setOrder
values.comment:
Set the drawing order of the dataset
This also affects stacking, tooltips, and legends

values.name: setStack
values.comment:
ID of the group, used for stacking datasets
eg. two datasets with the same field for stack will be stacked together

values.name: setXAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the X axis to plot the dataset on

values.name: setYAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the Y axis to plot the dataset on

name: Chartjs.DataSets.DoughnutAndPie

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment:
For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/doughnut.html>

You should not use the dataset type directly
Instead use the updater pipeline functions:

    defaultBarFromLabel "Example"
        |> setBackgroundColor (Common.All Color.red)
        |> setBorderColor (Common.All Color.white)
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : List.List Basics.Float, hidden : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, order : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderAlign : Maybe.Maybe String.String, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), circumference : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, cutout : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, hoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), offset : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Int), rotation : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, weight : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float }

values.name: defaultPieFromData
values.comment: Create a Pie dataset with a label and data

values.name: defaultPieFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Pie dataset with just a label

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the arcs

values.name: setBorderAlign
values.comment:
Whether the borders of each arc should overlap or not
Set to 'center' to overlap
Set to 'inner' to not overlap

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Color of the border

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Width of the border

values.name: setCircumference
values.comment: Total sweep, in degrees, to allow arcs to cover

values.name: setCutout
values.comment: Cutout, in pixels

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as an arc

values.name: setHidden
values.comment: Set whether this dataset should be hidden from the chart

values.name: setHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the arcs when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the arcs when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Width of the border when hovered

values.name: setLabel
values.comment: Set the label for this dataset

values.name: setOffset
values.comment: Offset for each arc, in pixels

values.name: setOrder
values.comment:
Set the drawing order of the dataset
This also affects stacking, tooltips, and legends

values.name: setRotation
values.comment: Starting angle, in degrees, to draw dataset from

values.name: setWeight
values.comment:
The relative thickness of this dataset
If specified, then this dataset will be drawn with a thickness relative to the sum of all dataset weights

name: Chartjs.DataSets.Line

unions.name: DataPoints
unions.comment:
These datasets can be made from two different data formats
Either a list of numbers can be specified, or a list of (x, y) tuples

See <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/general/data-structures.html> for more info

unions.name: FillBoundary
unions.comment:
Which boundary to use when using FillBoundary
Can be the scale origin, start, or end

unions.name: FillMode
unions.comment:
Fill modes handle how area charts should be displayed
Can be:

  - an absolute dataset index
  - a relative dataset index
  - between the dataset and the boundaries

unions.name: SteppedLine
unions.comment:
Step Interpolation for lines <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/3.3.2/charts/line.html#stepped>

BeforeInterpolation: Step-before Interpolation

AfterInterpolation: Step-after Interpolation

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment: For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/line.html>
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : Chartjs.DataSets.Line.DataPoints, hidden : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, order : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, indexAxis : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.IndexAxis, xAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, yAxisID : Maybe.Maybe String.String, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), borderDash : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), borderDashOffset : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, borderCapStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, borderJoinStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, cubicInterpolationMode : Maybe.Maybe String.String, fill : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.DataSets.Line.FillMode, lineTension : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, pointBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointStyle : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Chartjs.Common.PointStyle), pointRotation : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointHitRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointHoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointHoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), pointHoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), pointHoverRadius : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), showLine : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, spanGaps : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, steppedLine : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.DataSets.Line.SteppedLine }

values.name: defaultLineFromData
values.comment:
Create a Line dataset with a label and data list
To create a dataset from points, see defaultLineFromPointData

values.name: defaultLineFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Line dataset with just a label

values.name: defaultLineFromPointData
values.comment: Create a Line dataset with a label and points list

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment:
Fill color of the area under the bar
Applies for area charts

values.name: setBorderCapStyle
values.comment: Cap style of the line

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Color of the line

values.name: setBorderDash
values.comment: Length and spacing of line dashes

values.name: setBorderDashOffset
values.comment: Offset for line dashes

values.name: setBorderJoinStyle
values.comment: Joint style of the line

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Line width (in pixels)

values.name: setCubicInterpolationMode
values.comment:
Which cubic interpolation mode to use
'default' uses a weighted cubic interpolation
'monotone' is better at preserving monotonicity

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as a point on the line

values.name: setFill
values.comment:
How to fill the area under the line

The most common use case would be filling the area under a line. For that, you'll want to use Boundary Origin:

    defaultLineFromData "Title" data
        |> setBackgroundColor Color.red
        |> setFill (Boundary Origin)

For more information, check out <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/area.html>

values.name: setHidden
values.comment: Set whether this dataset should be hidden from the chart

values.name: setIndexAxis
values.comment:
Which axis to use for indexing
Set to XAxis for a vertical chart, set to YAxis for a horizontal chart

values.name: setLabel
values.comment: Set the label for this dataset

values.name: setLineTension
values.comment:
Beizer curve tension
0 is straight lines

This option is ignored if cubicInterpolation is set to 'monotone'

values.name: setOrder
values.comment:
Set the drawing order of the dataset
This also affects stacking, tooltips, and legends

values.name: setPointBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color for points

values.name: setPointBorderColor
values.comment: Border color for points

values.name: setPointBorderWidth
values.comment: Border width (in pixels) for points

values.name: setPointData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset, in a point based format
This is a list of tuples, where each tuple defines the X, Y location of a point

values.name: setPointHitRadius
values.comment: Hit radius for point interactivity

values.name: setPointHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color for points when hovered

values.name: setPointHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color for points when hovered

values.name: setPointHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Border width for points when hovered

values.name: setPointHoverRadius
values.comment: Radius for points when hovered

values.name: setPointRadius
values.comment: Radius of the point shape

values.name: setPointRotation
values.comment: Rotation of the point (in degrees)

values.name: setPointStyle
values.comment: Style of the point

values.name: setShowLine
values.comment: Whether the line for this dataset should be drawn

values.name: setSpanGaps
values.comment: Whether points with no data should be filled in or not

values.name: setSteppedLine
values.comment:
Set the step interpolation for the line

If set to anything other than false, lineTension will be ignored

values.name: setXAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the X axis to plot this dataset on

values.name: setYAxisID
values.comment: The ID of the Y axis to plot this dataset on

name: Chartjs.DataSets.Polar

aliases.name: DataSet
aliases.comment:
For further information on these properties, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/charts/polar.html>

You should not use the dataset type directly
Instead use the updater pipeline functions:

    defaultBarFromLabel "Example"
        |> setBackgroundColor (Common.All Color.red)
        |> setBorderColor (Common.All Color.white)
aliases.type: { label : String.String, data : List.List Basics.Float, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderAlign : Maybe.Maybe String.String, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float), hoverBackgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderColor : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Color.Color), hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe (Chartjs.Common.PointProperty Basics.Float) }

values.name: defaultPolarFromData
values.comment: Create a Polar dataset with a label and data

values.name: defaultPolarFromLabel
values.comment: Create a Polar dataset with just a label

values.name: setBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the segments

values.name: setBorderAlign
values.comment:
Whether the borders of each segment should overlap or not
Set to 'center' to overlap
Set to 'inner' to not overlap

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Color of the border

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Width of the border

values.name: setData
values.comment:
Set the data displayed by this dataset
This is a list of floats, where each float is represented as a segment on the chart

values.name: setHoverBackgroundColor
values.comment: Fill color of the segments when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderColor
values.comment: Border color of the segements when hovered

values.name: setHoverBorderWidth
values.comment: Width of the border when hovered

name: Chartjs.Options

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment: These options are applied to the whole chart and not an individual dataset
aliases.type: { animations : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Animations.Animations, layout : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Layout.Layout, legend : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Legend.Legend, title : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Title.Title, tooltips : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Tooltips.Tooltips, elements : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Elements, scales : Maybe.Maybe (List.List Chartjs.Options.Scale.Scale), maintainAspectRatio : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, responsive : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, cutoutPercentage : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, rotation : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, circumference : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float }

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment: Creates a blank options structure which can then be edited using the below set functions

values.name: setAnimations
values.comment: Set the animations property

values.name: setCircumference
values.comment: Set the sweep (in radians) that arcs are allowed to cover

values.name: setCutoutPercentage
values.comment:
Set the cutout percentage of this chart.
By default, Doughnuts are 50 and Pies are 0

values.name: setElements
values.comment: Set the elements property

values.name: setLayout
values.comment: Set the layout property

values.name: setLegend
values.comment: Set the legend property

values.name: setMaintainAspectRatio
values.comment: Set whether to keep the aspect ratio of this chart consistent

values.name: setResponsive
values.comment:
Set whether this chart should be responsive
Note: there is currently no parameters to directly set the width and hieght of the chart
I strongly recommend sizing the parent web component and leaving this option enabled

values.name: setRotation
values.comment: Set the starting angle (in radians) to draw arcs from

values.name: setScales
values.comment: Set the scales property

values.name: setTitle
values.comment: Set the title property

values.name: setTooltips
values.comment: Set the tootlips property

name: Chartjs.Options.Animations

unions.name: Easing
unions.comment:
Different easings for animations
To see examples of these easings, see <https://easings.net>

aliases.name: Animations
aliases.comment:
Animations structure
These settings will apply to all the animations in the chart

The default settings should work fine for most cases, but if needed,
you can use this object to fine-tune them
aliases.type: { duration : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, easing : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Animations.Easing, animateRotate : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, animateScale : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool }

values.name: defaultAnimations
values.comment: Create a blank animations object

values.name: setAnimateRotate
values.comment:
Used for Pie charts
Should the rotation of the chart be animated?

values.name: setAnimateScale
values.comment:
Used for Pie/Polar charts
Should the scaling of the chart be animated?

values.name: setDuration
values.comment: Time (in milliseconds) an animation takes

values.name: setEasing
values.comment: Easing function to use

name: Chartjs.Options.Elements
comment:
While there is ways to configure the styling of each dataset, sometimes you want custom styles applied to all datasets
For more information, see <https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/configuration/elements.html>

Please note that this module does not have updater functions and you will need to use record update syntax if using this functionality

@docs Elements, defaultElements, Point, defaultPoint, Line, LineFill, Rectangle, Arc

unions.name: LineFill
unions.comment:
Line fill mode
Useful for area charts

aliases.name: Arc
aliases.comment: Arc specific properties (eg. pie chart, polar chart)
aliases.type: { backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

aliases.name: Elements
aliases.comment: Controls for all element types in a chart
aliases.type: { point : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Point, line : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Line, rectangle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Rectangle, arc : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.Arc }

aliases.name: Line
aliases.comment: Line specific properties
aliases.type: { tension : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderCapStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.LineCap, borderDash : Maybe.Maybe (List.List Basics.Int), borderDashOffset : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderJoinStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.LineJoin, capBezierPoints : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, fill : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Elements.LineFill, stepped : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool }

aliases.name: Point
aliases.comment: Point specific properties
aliases.type: { radius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, pointStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.PointStyle, rotation : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, hitRadius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, hoverRadius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, hoverBorderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

aliases.name: Rectangle
aliases.comment: Rectangle specific properties (eg. bar charts)
aliases.type: { backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderSkipped : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position }

values.name: defaultElements
values.comment: Create a blank elements object

values.name: defaultPoint
values.comment: Create a blank point object

name: Chartjs.Options.Font

aliases.name: FontSpec
aliases.comment:
A font spec object controls how various chart text is rendered
This can be applied to things such as labels, legends, titles, etc.
aliases.type: { family : Maybe.Maybe String.String, lineHeight : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, size : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, style : Maybe.Maybe String.String, weight : Maybe.Maybe String.String }

values.name: create
values.comment: Quick function to create a basic font, specifying just the family and size

values.name: defaultFont
values.comment: Create a blank font object that can then be updated with the below functions

values.name: setFamily
values.comment: Set the font family to use - this follows the standard CSS font-family options

values.name: setLineHeight
values.comment: Set the height for each individual line of text

values.name: setSize
values.comment: Set the font size, in pixels

values.name: setStyle
values.comment: Set the font style. Does not apply to titles. Follows the standard CSS font-style options.

values.name: setWeight
values.comment: Set the font weight. Follows the standard CSS font-weight options.

unions.name: Layout
unions.comment:
Controls the amount of padding inside the chart
By default, this is 0 on all sides

This can be set as either Uniform (applied to all sides)
or Specific (different paddings for each side)
cases: { left : Basics.Int, right : Basics.Int, top : Basics.Int, bottom : Basics.Int }

name: Chartjs.Options.Legend

aliases.name: Labels
aliases.comment: Properties for the labels that make up the legend
aliases.type: { boxWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, boxHeight : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, color : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, font : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Font.FontSpec, padding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, pointStyle : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.PointStyle }

aliases.name: Legend
aliases.comment: The chart legend displays data about the datasets that are appearing on the chart
aliases.type: { display : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position, fullWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, reverse : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, labels : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Legend.Labels, title : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Legend.Title }

aliases.name: Title
aliases.type: { text : String.String, color : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, font : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Font.FontSpec, padding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

values.name: defaultLabels
values.comment: Create a blank labels object that can then be updated with the below functions

values.name: defaultLegend
values.comment: Create a blank legend object that can then be updated with the below functions

values.name: defaultTitle
values.comment: Create a blank legend title object that can then be updated with the below functions

values.name: setBoxHeight
values.comment: Specify the height of the coloured box / icon next to each legend entry

values.name: setBoxWidth
values.comment: Specify the width of the coloured box / icon next to each legend entry

values.name: setDisplay
values.comment: Is the legend shown?

values.name: setFullWidth
values.comment:
Marks that this box should take the full width of the canvas (pushing down other boxes).
This is unlikely to need to be changed in day-to-day use.

values.name: setLabelColor
values.comment: Set the text color to be used for legend labels

values.name: setLabelFont
values.comment: Set the font properties to be used for legend labels

values.name: setLabelPadding
values.comment: Set the padding around each legend label

values.name: setLabels
values.comment: Set properties for the labels of this legend

values.name: setPointStyle
values.comment: Set a special point style for the legend label boxes

values.name: setPosition
values.comment: Position of the legend (relative to the chart)

values.name: setReverse
values.comment: Legend will show datasets in reverse order

values.name: setTitle
values.comment: Set properties for the title of this legend

values.name: setTitleColor
values.comment: Set the text color for the legend title

values.name: setTitleFont
values.comment: Set the font properties for the legend title

values.name: setTitlePadding
values.comment: Set the padding around the legend title

name: Chartjs.Options.Scale

unions.name: ScaleType
unions.comment:
Linear and logarithmic scales work best

For categorical scales, you're probably best using a data object with labels set
For time scales, good luck

aliases.name: Scale
aliases.type: { id : String.String, type_ : Chartjs.Options.Scale.ScaleType, axis : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.IndexAxis, position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position, reverse : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, min : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, max : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, suggestedMin : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, suggestedMax : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Float, grid : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Scale.ScaleGrid, title : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Scale.ScaleTitle }

aliases.name: ScaleGrid
aliases.comment: Styling properties for the grid lines of a scale
aliases.type: { borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, gridColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, drawBorder : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, drawTicks : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, tickColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, tickLength : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, tickWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

aliases.name: ScaleTitle
aliases.comment: Scale titles are used for labelling the graph axes
aliases.type: { text : String.String, color : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, font : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Font.FontSpec, padding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

values.name: defaultGrid
values.comment: Create a blank grid properties object that can then be manipulated

values.name: defaultScale
values.comment:
Given a scale type and an ID, creates an empty scale object

It's best practice to set the ID of your scales to "x" or "y", depending on what axis you need
For more complicated use cases, you can assign these objects to datasets using the XAxisID / YAxisID properties

values.name: defaultTitle
values.comment: Create a basic title from the given text

values.name: setAxis
values.comment:
Set the axis for this scale - is this an X axis or a Y axis?

If this is not set, Chartjs will try and guess based on the first letter of your axis ID
For best practices, you should set this explicitly!

values.name: setBorderColor
values.comment: Set the edge border color

values.name: setBorderWidth
values.comment: Set the edge border width

values.name: setDrawBorder
values.comment: Set whether the border should be drawn

values.name: setDrawTicks
values.comment: Set whether to draw the tick dashes

values.name: setGrid
values.comment: Set the grid properties for this scale

values.name: setGridColor
values.comment: Set the color of grid lines

values.name: setMax
values.comment:
Set the maximum value for this scale
This will override the maximum value from the data

values.name: setMin
values.comment:
Set the minimum value for this scale
This will override the minimum value from the data

values.name: setPosition
values.comment: Set the position of this scale

values.name: setReverse
values.comment: Set whether the ticks on this scale should be reversed

values.name: setSuggestedMax
values.comment: Set a suggestion, used when calculating the maximum extent

values.name: setSuggestedMin
values.comment: Set a suggestion, used when calculating the minimum extent

values.name: setTickColor
values.comment: Set the color of the tick dashes

values.name: setTickLength
values.comment: Set the length (how far into the chart they extend) of tick dashes

values.name: setTickWidth
values.comment: Set the width of tick dashes

values.name: setTitle
values.comment: Set the title properties for this scale

values.name: setTitleColor
values.comment: Set the text color for this title

values.name: setTitleFont
values.comment: Set the font properties for this title text

values.name: setTitlePadding
values.comment: Set the padding around the title text

name: Chartjs.Options.Title

aliases.name: Title
aliases.comment: The Title is text that is drawn outside of the Chart
aliases.type: { display : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, align : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Align, position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Common.Position, padding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, text : Maybe.Maybe String.String, font : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Font.FontSpec, color : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color }

values.name: defaultTitle
values.comment: Create a blank title object

values.name: setAlign
values.comment: Text alignment of the title

values.name: setColor
values.comment: Color for the title text

values.name: setDisplay
values.comment: Is the title shown?

values.name: setFont
values.comment: Font properties to use for the title text

values.name: setPadding
values.comment: Padding (in pixels) above and below the title text

values.name: setPosition
values.comment: Position of the title

values.name: setText
values.comment: Title text to be displayed

name: Chartjs.Options.Tooltips

unions.name: Mode
unions.comment:
Controls what elements are displayed in the tooltip
Point: finds all items that intersect the point
Nearest: gets the items that are at the nearest distance to the point
Index: finds item at the same index
X: find all items that interesct (based on X axis only)
Y: find all items that intersect (based on Y axis only)

unions.name: PositionMode
unions.comment:
Positioning mode for tooltips

Average will place the tooltip at the average position of the displayed items
Nearest will place the tooltip at the element closest to the event position

aliases.name: Tooltips
aliases.comment: Tooltips are displayed when interacting with charts
aliases.type: { enabled : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, mode : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Tooltips.Mode, intersect : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, position : Maybe.Maybe Chartjs.Options.Tooltips.PositionMode, backgroundColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, titleFontFamily : Maybe.Maybe String.String, titleFontSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, titleFontStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, titleFontColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, titleSpacing : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, titleMarginBottom : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, bodyFontFamily : Maybe.Maybe String.String, bodyFontSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, bodyFontStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, bodyFontColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, bodySpacing : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, footerFontFamily : Maybe.Maybe String.String, footerFontSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, footerFontStyle : Maybe.Maybe String.String, footerFontColor : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, footerSpacing : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, footerMarginTop : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, xPadding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, yPadding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, caretPadding : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, carretSize : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, cornerRadius : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int, multiKeyBackground : Maybe.Maybe Color.Color, displayColors : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, borderColor : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Bool, borderWidth : Maybe.Maybe Basics.Int }

values.name: defaultTooltips
values.comment: Create a blank tooltips object
